attributes.action: Stop the demolition of the Worcester Sansome Walk Swimming pool site
attributes.additional_details:
The site could be demolished around Sep time which not only will cost a lot of money due to the building containing aspestos but will also contest the area. 
I feel this site contains a lot of memories for a lot of people, young and old and would be a shame to demolish it. 
It would be nice to reopen the site and use it again for something else rather than demolish it. Reusing this site could bring more people to the area, could benefit local businesses and continue the heratige of the site.
attributes.background: The Worcester city council are making sale arrangements with Sanctuary housing and the YMCA to develop a site that provides property for the homeless. This is something which many locals are against and we would like to hear your views on this. Please use the petition to voice your opinion on this.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
